analytic.title: Investigation of the active copper sites responsible for high conversion of methane to methanol in Cu-MAZ Experiment number: 31-01-76

application.desc: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents
application.label: unknown

startPage=-1, endPage=-1, consolidateCitations=1, consolidateHeader=1, consolidateFunders=0, includeRawAffiliations=false, includeRawCitations=true, includeRawCopyrights=false, generateTeiIds=false, generateTeiCoordinates=[], flavor=null

div.p: The isothermal, low-temperature stepwise conversion of methane to methanol over copper-exchanged zeolites eliminates the time-consuming heating and cooling steps of the conventional high temperature activation approach. To better understand differences between the two approaches, a series of zeolites were screened, of which omega zeolite (MAZ) showed superior performance in both the isothermal and conventional approaches.
